intro: Hieracium glaucopsis, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium glaucopsis is often found in temperate regions and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
